title: Adidas Sales Analysis
text: This project analyzes Adidas sales data from Kaggle to understand performance trends across product categories, regions, and customer segments. Using Excel-based data cleaning and dashboard development, the study highlights key revenue drivers and operational challenges in the retail ecosystem.

title: Adidas Sales Analysis
text: This project analyzes Adidas sales data from Kaggle to understand performance trends across product categories, regions, and customer segments. Using Excel-based data cleaning and dashboard development, the study highlights key revenue drivers and operational challenges in the retail ecosystem.

title: Adidas Sales Analysis
text:
What I Did

Collected and cleaned raw sales data from Kaggle, addressing missing values, inconsistencies, and formatting issues.
Structured and categorized supply chain data by product type, gender, and sales region to enhance data usability.
Built interactive Excel dashboards that visualize sales trends, regional performance, and seasonal demand patterns.
Identified business insights such as peak sales periods and underperforming regions, informing pricing and inventory decisions.

title: Adidas Sales Analysis
text:
Methods & Tools
Excel Â· Data Cleaning Â· Data Organization Â· Interactive Dashboards Â· Trend Analysis

title: Adidas Sales Analysis
text:
Key Results

Found that womenâ€™s product sales consistently peaked in Q4 across multiple regions.
Identified specific regions with lower operating profit margins, providing evidence for targeted strategic adjustments.
Improved accessibility and interpretability of raw sales data through structured dashboards.

title: Adidas Sales Analysis
text:
Impact
This analysis provides businesses with actionable insights into seasonal demand, regional market performance, and product-level trends, supporting informed decision-making in retail operations.

title: Human-Following Robot with Real-Time Face Tracking
text: This project involved building a real-time human-following robot capable of detecting, tracking, and re-identifying a target person using embedded computer vision and machine learning. The system integrates Rubik Pi for face detection and recognition, and MegaPi/mBot Mega for motor control, creating a fully automated movement pipeline from camera input to physical actuation.

title: Human-Following Robot with Real-Time Face Tracking
text: This project involved building a real-time human-following robot capable of detecting, tracking, and re-identifying a target person using embedded computer vision and machine learning. The system integrates Rubik Pi for face detection and recognition, and MegaPi/mBot Mega for motor control, creating a fully automated movement pipeline from camera input to physical actuation.

title: Human-Following Robot with Real-Time Face Tracking
text:
What I Did

Designed the end-to-end system architecture integrating Rubik Pi (vision inference) and MegaPi (motor control) into a real-time perception â†’ decision â†’ action loop.
Developed face detection and recognition modules, including alignment, normalization, feature extraction, and tracking logic.
Implemented a YOLO-based fallback for robust re-identification when face tracking temporarily failed.
Built communication logic between inference and motor modules using Python, Arduino, and local HTTP streaming for debugging and calibration.
Tuned and calibrated the system to fix motor drift, reduce latency, and correct camera-to-motor alignment errors through iterative testing.

title: Human-Following Robot with Real-Time Face Tracking
text:
Methods & Tools
Rubik Pi Â· MegaPi/mBot Mega Â· YOLO Â· Python Â· Arduino Â· Real-Time Vision Â· Embedded ML Â· Edge Computing

title: Human-Following Robot with Real-Time Face Tracking
text:
Key Results

Successfully implemented a fully functional human-following robot capable of tracking and re-identifying the target in real time.
Achieved smooth motor control and stable tracking through iterative calibration and feedback loops.
Demonstrated reliable fallback behavior with YOLO-based detection during occlusion or temporary recognition failure.

title: Human-Following Robot with Real-Time Face Tracking
text:
Impact
This project showcases the integration of embedded vision, robotics, and machine learning to create real-time interactive systems, demonstrating strong engineering skills in perception, control, and hardwareâ€“software integration.

title: Measuring Ethical Risks in AI-Generated News Using NLP
text: This project evaluates ethical risks in AI-generated news by combining modern NLP techniques with ethical analysis frameworks. Using DistilBERT and semantic similarity methods, the study identifies harmful patterns such as biased framing, hate-speech tendencies, and ethically drifted content, mapping them directly to the UNESCO AI Ethics principles.

title: Measuring Ethical Risks in AI-Generated News Using NLP
text: This project evaluates ethical risks in AI-generated news by combining modern NLP techniques with ethical analysis frameworks. Using DistilBERT and semantic similarity methods, the study identifies harmful patterns such as biased framing, hate-speech tendencies, and ethically drifted content, mapping them directly to the UNESCO AI Ethics principles.

title: Measuring Ethical Risks in AI-Generated News Using NLP
text:
What I Did

Implemented transformer-based text classification models using DistilBERT to detect harmful or ethically questionable content in AI-generated news.
Preprocessed and engineered text features using tokenization, padding, truncation, TFâ€“IDF vectors, and topic-aligned embeddings.
Applied semantic similarity and cosine-distance methods to align classified content with UNESCO AI Ethics principles.
Analyzed ethical drift across different news topics and model outputs to identify patterns of misinformation, bias, and discriminatory framing.

title: Measuring Ethical Risks in AI-Generated News Using NLP
text:
Methods & Tools
DistilBERT Â· Transformers Â· Tokenization Â· TFâ€“IDF Â· Embeddings Â· Cosine Similarity Â· Python Â· NLP

title: Measuring Ethical Risks in AI-Generated News Using NLP
text:
Key Results

Successfully detected ethical violations and hate-speech signals across multiple AI-generated news samples.
Identified consistent ethical drift patterns that aligned with specific UNESCO principles, enabling structured interpretation of content risk.
Demonstrated how NLP-based classification and similarity scoring can support responsible AI oversight.

title: Measuring Ethical Risks in AI-Generated News Using NLP
text:
Impact
This project highlights how NLP and ethical frameworks can be combined to assess risks in AI-generated content, providing a foundation for building more responsible AI evaluation tools.

title: Measuring Ethical Risks in AI-Generated News Using NLP

title: Oil Fraud Crime Pattern Analysis
text: This project investigates nationwide fuel station fraud patterns by integrating regulatory data, business information, and geospatial risk factors. In collaboration with the Korea National Oil Management Institute, the analysis explores behavioral trends, environmental features, and historical violations to build predictive insights for fraud detection.

title: Oil Fraud Crime Pattern Analysis
text: This project investigates nationwide fuel station fraud patterns by integrating regulatory data, business information, and geospatial risk factors. In collaboration with the Korea National Oil Management Institute, the analysis explores behavioral trends, environmental features, and historical violations to build predictive insights for fraud detection.

title: Oil Fraud Crime Pattern Analysis
text:
What I Did

Collaborated with the Korea National Oil Management Institute to analyze nationwide fuel station violation data and business registration information.
Collected and integrated external datasets such as proximity to police stations, streetlight density, and local station clustering to enhance risk modeling.
Applied machine learning models (Random Forest, Decision Tree) to identify high-risk fuel stations and evaluate fraud likelihood.
Used QGIS and geospatial visualization techniques to map risk hotspots and illustrate key environmental factors.
Summarized insights for regulatory teams through PowerPoint, supporting targeted and data-driven inspection planning.

title: Oil Fraud Crime Pattern Analysis
text:
Methods & Tools
QGIS Â· Python Â· Jupyter Notebook Â· R Â· Random Forest Â· Decision Tree Â· GIS Analysis Â· External Data Integration

title: Oil Fraud Crime Pattern Analysis
text:
Key Results

Identified critical environmental and operational features strongly associated with repeat fraud violations.
Built predictive models capable of ranking stations by risk level to support proactive regulatory intervention.
Visualized spatial fraud patterns revealing geographic clusters and recurring behavioral indicators.

title: Oil Fraud Crime Pattern Analysis
text:
Impact
The project enhanced the effectiveness of regulatory oversight by providing a data-driven framework for fraud detection, enabling authorities to prioritize inspections and mitigate risk efficiently.

title: COVID-19 & U.S. Economy: State-Level Analysis
text: This project evaluates the economic impact of COVID-19 at the U.S. state level by integrating multiple datasets spanning health data, housing markets, labor statistics, GDP, income, and household debt. Using R and tidyverse tools, the analysis compares pre-pandemic (2017â€“2019) and post-pandemic (2020â€“2022) trends to reveal structural economic shifts.

title: COVID-19 & U.S. Economy: State-Level Analysis
text: This project evaluates the economic impact of COVID-19 at the U.S. state level by integrating multiple datasets spanning health data, housing markets, labor statistics, GDP, income, and household debt. Using R and tidyverse tools, the analysis compares pre-pandemic (2017â€“2019) and post-pandemic (2020â€“2022) trends to reveal structural economic shifts.

title: COVID-19 & U.S. Economy: State-Level Analysis
text:
What I Did

Gathered and merged over ten datasets from CDC, Zillow, BEA, BLS, and the New York Fed, covering COVID cases, housing prices, GDP, unemployment, income, and household debt.
Performed extensive data cleaning and cross-timeframe alignment to enable fair comparisons between pre-COVID and post-COVID economic conditions.
Created bar plots, line graphs, and violin plots to visualize changes in spending, debt, income, and unemployment across 50 states.
Delivered an interactive HTML report summarizing economic trends and identifying states with stronger or weaker resilience during the pandemic.

title: COVID-19 & U.S. Economy: State-Level Analysis
text:
Methods & Tools
R Â· tidyverse Â· ggplot2 Â· readxl Â· RMarkdown Â· Data Wrangling Â· Economic Analysis Â· Visualization

title: COVID-19 & U.S. Economy: State-Level Analysis
text:
Key Results

Revealed clear shifts in consumer spending, income distribution, and labor market stability across states.
Highlighted states with disproportionate increases in household debt and unemployment.
Identified divergent housing market trends across regions, informed by integrated Zillow and BEA datasets.

title: COVID-19 & U.S. Economy: State-Level Analysis
text:
Impact
This project provides a comprehensive state-level overview of the pandemicâ€™s economic effects and supports evidence-based regional resilience planning.

title: Toronto Building Audit Risk Analysis & Prediction
text: This project analyzes Torontoâ€™s annual building evaluation data to identify audit risks and support regulatory decision-making. By combining SQL-based filtering, exploratory analyses, and supervised machine learning models, the study offers a data-driven approach to predicting high-risk buildings.

title: Toronto Building Audit Risk Analysis & Prediction
text: This project analyzes Torontoâ€™s annual building evaluation data to identify audit risks and support regulatory decision-making. By combining SQL-based filtering, exploratory analyses, and supervised machine learning models, the study offers a data-driven approach to predicting high-risk buildings.

title: Toronto Building Audit Risk Analysis & Prediction
text:
What I Did

Conducted exploratory analysis on Torontoâ€™s building audit dataset using SQL and Python to identify structural, financial, and environmental risk indicators.
Developed machine learning models (Random Forest, Decision Tree) to classify high-risk buildings and guide audit prioritization.
Applied SMOTE to improve predictive performance by addressing severe class imbalance common in fraud and regulatory datasets.
Designed geospatial and statistical visualizations using Seaborn, Matplotlib, and Folium to communicate insights clearly.
Summarized results through Streamlit dashboards and PowerPoint presentations for audit teams and stakeholders.

title: Toronto Building Audit Risk Analysis & Prediction
text:
Methods & Tools
Python Â· Pandas Â· NumPy Â· SQL Â· Seaborn Â· Matplotlib Â· Folium Â· Streamlit Â· Random Forest Â· Decision Tree Â· SMOTE

title: Toronto Building Audit Risk Analysis & Prediction
text:
Key Results

Improved fraud detection and audit targeting by correcting class imbalance and enhancing model accuracy.
Identified key predictors of high-risk buildings, informing more efficient audit resource allocation.
Delivered visual dashboards and reports that simplified interpretation of complex regulatory data.

title: Toronto Building Audit Risk Analysis & Prediction
text:
Impact
This project provides a scalable and actionable framework for regulatory audits, enabling departments to detect at-risk buildings early and conduct data-informed inspections.

title: Large-Scale Reddit AI Discourse Analysis
text: This project analyzes large-scale Reddit discussions related to artificial intelligence to understand how topics, language, and timing influence user engagement and content virality. Using distributed data processing and NLP techniques, I examined patterns across multiple AI-focused subreddits and compared AI discourse with politically influenced discussions.

title: Large-Scale Reddit AI Discourse Analysis
text: This project analyzes large-scale Reddit discussions related to artificial intelligence to understand how topics, language, and timing influence user engagement and content virality. Using distributed data processing and NLP techniques, I examined patterns across multiple AI-focused subreddits and compared AI discourse with politically influenced discussions.

title: Large-Scale Reddit AI Discourse Analysis
text:
What I Did

Engineered temporal engagement features (day-of-week, hour-of-day) to analyze posting behavior and engagement dynamics.
Aggregated and processed billions of Reddit rows using PySpark to enable scalable analysis across 15 AI-related subreddits.
Built an NLP pipeline using regex-based UDFs, tokenization, and CountVectorizer to prepare text data for modeling.
Trained and compared dual 15-topic LDA models to contrast AI-focused discourse with politically influenced narratives.
Developed regression and classification models (Lasso, Logistic Regression, Gradient Boosted Trees) using TFâ€“IDF features, topic vectors, and metadata.

title: Large-Scale Reddit AI Discourse Analysis
text:
Methods & Tools
PySpark Â· Python Â· NLP Â· LDA Topic Modeling Â· TFâ€“IDF Â· Logistic Regression Â· Gradient Boosted Trees Â· Distributed Computing Â· Feature Engineering

title: Large-Scale Reddit AI Discourse Analysis
text:
Key Results

Identified optimal engagement windows by analyzing posting time versus score and comment activity.
Revealed distinct thematic differences between AI-centric discussions and politically influenced discourse through topic modeling.
Demonstrated that linguistic features and topic composition are strong predictors of Reddit post virality.

title: Large-Scale Reddit AI Discourse Analysis
text:
Impact
This project demonstrates the application of scalable NLP and machine learning techniques to real-world social media data, highlighting how data-driven insights can explain online engagement patterns and information diffusion at scale.

title: Large-Scale Reddit AI Discourse Analysis

title: Distributed Big Data Processing of NYC Taxi Trips
text: This project focuses on building a scalable and distributed data pipeline for analyzing large volumes of NYC taxi trip data. Using PySpark and AWS services, the system processes millions of records, integrates multiple storage layers, and evaluates modern analytical engines to optimize performance and latency.

title: Distributed Big Data Processing of NYC Taxi Trips
text: This project focuses on building a scalable and distributed data pipeline for analyzing large volumes of NYC taxi trip data. Using PySpark and AWS services, the system processes millions of records, integrates multiple storage layers, and evaluates modern analytical engines to optimize performance and latency.

title: Distributed Big Data Processing of NYC Taxi Trips
text:
What I Did

Built a distributed data pipeline using PySpark and AWS EC2/S3 to process millions of NYC taxi trip records.
Integrated AWS Glue and Athena to enable high-performance schema management, data cataloging, and federated querying.
Benchmarked analytical engines such as DuckDB and Polars to identify performance gaps and optimize computation speed.
Developed reproducible large-scale workflows to improve query efficiency across different storage formats and processing frameworks.

title: Distributed Big Data Processing of NYC Taxi Trips

Methods & Tools
PySpark Â· AWS EC2 Â· AWS S3 Â· AWS Glue Â· AWS Athena Â· DuckDB Â· Polars Â· Python Â· Distributed Computing

title: Distributed Big Data Processing of NYC Taxi Trips
text:
Key Results

Achieved substantial reductions in pipeline latency by comparing analytical engines and optimizing execution plans.
Enabled scalable querying and transformation of large datasets through AWS Glue/Athena integration.
Demonstrated effective multi-engine benchmarking for real-world big-data decision making.

title: Distributed Big Data Processing of NYC Taxi Trips

title: Anna Kim
text: I am a Data Science M.S. student at American University with a strong interest in natural language processing, machine learning, and large-scale data analytics. My work focuses on transforming complex, real-world data into actionable insights while building responsible and interpretable AI systems.

title: Anna Kim
text: I am a Data Science M.S. student at American University with a strong interest in natural language processing, machine learning, and large-scale data analytics. My work focuses on transforming complex, real-world data into actionable insights while building responsible and interpretable AI systems.

title: Anna Kim

What I Work On

title: Anna Kim
text:
How I Think & Work
I care deeply about the interpretability, fairness, and ethical implications of data-driven systems. I enjoy working at the intersection of technical rigor and real-world impact, and I value reproducible workflows, clear communication, and collaborative problem-solving.

title: Anna Kim
text:
Beyond Work
Outside of my academic and professional work, I enjoy participating in global education initiatives, attending technical conferences, and exploring interdisciplinary research that connects data science with societal challenges.
